One adult staff member, adult volunteer, counselor, or assistant counselor is on duty and supervising the campers for each group of ten campers or a fraction of ten campers;
An adult with cardiopulmonary resuscitation certification from a national organization is on duty; and
An adult with first aid certification from a national organization is on duty.
An operator shall ensure that the camp's contact person maintains trip information including:
A roster of participants;
Departure and return times;
Attendance during the:
Departure;
Activity; and
Return;
An itinerary;
The route taken; and
Inclement weather plans;
Specialized Activity and Camp Trip Safety Training. An operator shall ensure that:
Not more than 30 calendar days before working at the camp's specialized activity or participating in a trip, each staff member or volunteer:
Is trained in the camp's safety plan;
Demonstrates knowledge of the camp's safety plan; and
Is provided with the opportunity to discuss the procedures and have any questions answered by a supervisor; and
Documentation is kept on file that each staff member or volunteer received the training required in §C(1) of this regulation.
Specialized Activity and Camp Trip Safety Procedures. An operator shall ensure that:
A camper is instructed in safety procedures and the use of protective equipment;
A camper, staff member, or volunteer is provided with and uses safety equipment suitable to the specialized activity or camp trip; and
The specialized activity or trip is conducted according to the safety plan.
When a camper, staff member, or volunteer is transported, an operator shall ensure that:
Transportation is provided according to applicable State law;
A transportation safety plan is developed and implemented that includes:
Transportation safety rules, standards, and practices;
Supervision requirements including camper to staff ratios;
Emergency transportation services; and
Severe weather procedures;
Not more than 30 calendar days before the camp uses transportation, each staff member or volunteer involved in the transportation and each transportation service provider or driver:
Is trained in the camp's transportation safety plan;
Demonstrates knowledge of the camp's transportation safety plan; and
Is provided with the opportunity to discuss the procedures and have questions answered by a supervisor;
Documentation is kept on file that each staff member or volunteer received the training required in §A(3) of this regulation;
A camper, staff member, or volunteer is provided with and uses transportation safety equipment;
The driver of a vehicle is:
An adult; and
Licensed according to applicable State law;
The number of occupants in a vehicle does not exceed the vehicle manufacturer's seating capacity;
Before a camper is transported, written authorization from a camper's parent or guardian is obtained; and
Vehicular traffic is controlled on the campsite.
When the camp operator provides or arranges camper transportation to camp, from camp, or to and from camp, the operator shall:
Ensure that a director is available for consultation;
Provide written information to the camper's parent or guardian that includes the:
Camper's pick-up time and designated pick-up location;
Camper's drop-off time and designated drop-off location;
Camp's pick-up and drop-off safety procedures;
Camp's policy concerning the camp's responsibility for supervising a camper when the camper is picked up, dropped off, and transported;

Obtain a written agreement from the camper's parent or guardian concerning the parent's or guardian's responsibility for supervising a camper before the camper is picked up and after the camper is dropped off; and
In addition to the driver, ensure that one assistant counselor or adult is on duty and supervising the campers when there are ten or more campers in a vehicle.
An operator may not transport a camper in a:
Non-passenger vehicle; or
An individual's car without obtaining written authorization from the:
Camper's parent or guardian; and
Owner of the vehicle.

section.heading: Supervision of Campers During Routine Activities.
section.text: During a routine activity, an operator shall ensure that:

para.text: A camp director is available for consultation at all times when campers are present at a camp;
For campers who are 3-1/2 to 5 years old:
When there are one to eight campers, one adult is on duty and supervising the camper or campers;
When there are nine to 16 campers, on duty and supervising the campers are:
One adult; and
A second staff member who is an assistant counselor or adult;
When there are 17 to 24 campers, on duty and supervising the campers are:
One adult; and
Two additional staff members who are assistant counselors or adults; and
A group does not exceed 24 campers;
For campers who are 6 to 10 years old:
When there are one to 15 campers, one adult is on duty and supervising the campers;
When there are 16 to 30 campers, on duty and supervising the campers are:
One adult and two assistant counselors; or
Two adults; and
A group does not exceed 30 campers;
For campers who are 11 years old or older:
When there are one to 15 campers, one adult is on duty and supervising the campers;
When there are 16 to 30 campers, on duty and supervising the campers are:
One adult and two assistant counselors; or
Two adults;
When there are 31 to 40 campers, on duty and supervising the campers are:
Two adults and two assistant counselors; or
Three adults; and
A group does not exceed 40 campers;
When a camper who is 3-1/2 to 5 years old is grouped together with older campers, supervision is provided as required in §B of this regulation;
When a camper who is 6 to 10 years old is grouped together with older campers, supervision is provided as required in §C of this regulation; and
An assistant counselor under the direction of an adult may supervise, for up to 30 minutes, no more than five campers without an adult supervisor present.

section.heading: Implementation of This Chapter.
section.text: Implementation of this chapter is contingent on the availability of funds.
